problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.initialization: ITEMS: Annotated[list[Item], Len(20, 20)] = [ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ITEM4, ITEM5, ITEM6, ITEM7, ITEM8, ITEM9, ITEM10, ITEM11, ITEM12, ITEM13, ITEM14, ITEM15, ITEM16, ITEM17, ITEM18, ITEM19, ITEM20]

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as the objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_in_box_fit_exactly(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_right_edge: int = positions[i].x + items[i].width
        item_bottom_edge: int = positions[i].y + items[i].height
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert item_right_edge <= box_width
        assert item_bottom_edge <= box_height

items_in_box_fit_exactly(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Non-overlapping constraints
                assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or \
                       positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or \
                       positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or \
                       positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # For each box, ensure items fit within box dimensions
    for box_id in range(1, 21):
        # Track total area usage per box to ensure no overlap and exact fit
        # Using auxiliary variables for width and height sums would be less direct
        # Instead, check each item's position constraints directly
        for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == box_id:
                # Item must fit within box boundaries
                assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
                assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
                assert positions[i].x >= 0
                assert positions[i].y >= 0

    # Ensure no overlapping items within the same box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Items are in the same box; ensure no overlap
                # Overlap condition: rectangles overlap if neither is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                # Non-overlap constraints:
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap_and_fit_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

    # Ensure no overlapping items within the same box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Non-overlapping constraint: at least one of these must be true:
                # i is to the left of j, j is to the left of i,
                # i is above j, or j is above i.
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

ensure_no_overlap_and_fit_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def assign_items_to_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

    # Ensure that all items fit within their assigned boxes and do not overlap
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Boundary checks: item must be within box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

    # No overlapping items within the same box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Non-overlapping constraints
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

assign_items_to_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300)
})

Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=300),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=300)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 300
BOX_WIDTH : int = 300
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 14, "height": 69}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 23, "height": 86}, {"width": 84, "height": 42}, {"width": 12, "height": 72}, {"width": 97, "height": 96}, {"width": 60, "height": 71}, {"width": 57, "height": 86}, {"width": 77, "height": 62}, {"width": 41, "height": 56}, {"width": 7, "height": 56}, {"width": 62, "height": 84}, {"width": 29, "height": 97}, {"width": 63, "height": 82}, {"width": 53, "height": 62}, {"width": 22, "height": 93}, {"width": 25, "height": 64}, {"width": 50, "height": 96}, {"width": 21, "height": 45}, {"width": 92, "height": 1}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

               assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis
                x_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                                      (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                                      (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap
                assert x_not_overlap or y_not_overlap

    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                # Case 1: item i is to the left of item j
                # Case 2: item j is to the left of item i
                # Case 3: item i is below item j
                # Case 4: item j is below item i
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping constraints
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

def ensure_item_assignment_uniqueness(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    # Each item is assigned to exactly one box; this is implicitly ensured by the domain of assignments[i].
    # We add a constraint to ensure that the assignment indices are within valid range.
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_uniqueness(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=300),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=300)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 300
BOX_WIDTH : int = 300
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 14, "height": 69}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 23, "height": 86}, {"width": 84, "height": 42}, {"width": 12, "height": 72}, {"width": 97, "height": 96}, {"width": 60, "height": 71}, {"width": 57, "height": 86}, {"width": 77, "height": 62}, {"width": 41, "height": 56}, {"width": 7, "height": 56}, {"width": 62, "height": 84}, {"width": 29, "height": 97}, {"width": 63, "height": 82}, {"width": 53, "height": 62}, {"width": 22, "height": 93}, {"width": 25, "height": 64}, {"width": 50, "height": 96}, {"width": 21, "height": 45}, {"width": 92, "height": 1}]
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
